meanings.definition: Anointing with oil or ointment as a religious rite or as a symbol of consecration.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the priest performed the unction on the newborn baby.
meanings.sent2: The unction of the king was a sacred ritual in the ancient kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The unction of the chef's secret sauce made the dish taste heavenly.
meanings.sent4: The unction of the paintbrush on the canvas transformed it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The unction of the healing balm on the wound brought instant relief to the patient.

meanings.definition: The act of anointing as a medical treatment or for soothing purposes.
meanings.sent1: The nurse applied the unction to the patient's skin to reduce inflammation.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, unction was commonly used to alleviate muscle pain.
meanings.sent3: The unction of the soothing lotion on the sunburnt skin felt refreshing.
meanings.sent4: The unction of the massage oil on the tired muscles eased the tension away.
meanings.sent5: The unction of the herbal remedy on the sore throat brought quick relief to the child.
